did.unittitle: W. E. B. Du Bois Collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The W. E. B. Du Bois Collection contains Correspondence, Writings, including drafts of Dusk of Dawn, and The World and Africa, and Subject Files.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Du Bois, W. E. B. (William Edward Burghardt), 1868-1963

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The W. E. B. DuBois Collection contains items presented to the James Weldon Johnson Collection by Mr. DuBois, by way of Carl Van Vechten, with additional items from other persons.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The W. E. B. Dubois Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: W. E. B. Dubois Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature. Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing manuscripts inventory. All pertinent information has been retained.

bioghist.head: W. E. B. DUBOIS (1868-1963)
bioghist.p: W. E. B. Dubois secured his position as one of the key voices in the argument over the role of the black man in modern America through his seemingly endless works of social activism. He was an educator (at Fisk University and Atlanta University), a founder of the Niagara Movement (which later merged into the NAACP), the long-time editor of the NAACP publication, The Crisis , a lecturer, political activist, and prolific writer. His works include: The Souls of Black Folk , Dusk of Dawn , and an Autobiography (published posthumously).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials pertaining to W. E. B. Dubois.
